snippet: A history of strain between Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri and the black community dates back to the 1990s, when he was attorney general and fought to end a school desegregation program.
abstract: Unrest in Missouri over shooting of teenager Michael Brown by police officer and Gov Jay Nixon's attempts to handle aftermath has brought back to light history of strain between Nixon and black community; tensions date to 1990s when Nixon was state's attorney general and fought school desegregation program.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and JOHN ELIGON
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Bellerive, Mo., and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo.

lead_paragraph: A history of strain between Gov. Jay Nixon of Missouri and the black community dates back to the 1990s, when he was attorney general and fought to end a school desegregation program.

headline.main: For Missouri Governor, Test at an Uneasy Time
headline.print_headline: For Missouri Governor, Test at an Uneasy Time
